content.question:
<math alttext="2 H 2 O 2 aqueous reacts in the presence of K I, solid, to produce 2 H 2 O liquid plus O 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mtext>  H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KI</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mover><msub><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mo>⁢</mo><mtext> </mtext></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="Rate equals, k times the molar concentration of H 2 O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>R</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><msub><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

A student performed an experiment to study the factors that affect the rate of the first-order catalytic decomposition of <math alttext="H 2 O 2, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><msub><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, represented above.

The student monitored the volume of <math alttext="O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> produced over time as the reaction proceeded. The data from two trials are plotted in the graph above. Which of the following best explains the results of trial <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> compared with those of trial <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> ?

choices.label: The reaction temperature in trial <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> was higher than it was in trial <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.
The volume of the reaction vessel was larger in trial <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> than it was in trial <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.

The student used a smaller amount of <math alttext="K I, solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>K</mtext><mtext>I</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> in trial <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> compared with that used in trial <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.

The concentration of <math alttext="H 2 O 2, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> was lower in trial <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> than it was in trial <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.

content.answer: The concentration of <math alttext="H 2 O 2, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> was lower in trial <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> than it was in trial <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.

skill.text: 6.F: Explain the connection between experimental results and chemical concepts, processes, or theories.
